identificationModule.briefTitle: Treadmill With Biofeedback on Gait Symmetry After Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effects of Treadmill With Biofeedback on Gait Symmetry in Individuals With Chronic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study aims to investigate the immediate, accumulated, and maintainable effects of treadmill with biofeedback on gait symmetry in individuals with chronic stroke.

armGroups.label: Treadmill with auditory and visual feedback group
interventionNames: Other: Treadmill with auditory and visual feedback

interventions.name: Treadmill with auditory feedback
interventions.description: Participants will receive training 3 times per week for 4 weeks (12 sessions).

interventions.name: Treadmill with visual feedback
interventions.description: Participants will receive training 3 times per week for 4 weeks (12 sessions).

interventions.name: Treadmill with auditory and visual feedback
interventions.description: Participants will receive training 3 times per week for 4 weeks (12 sessions).

interventions.name: Treadmill training
interventions.description: Participants will receive training 3 times per week for 4 weeks (12 sessions).

primaryOutcomes.description: Temporal symmetry ratio: 1-(single support time of affected limb/single support time of unaffected limb)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline at the first day, 4 weeks, and 8 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Single stroke experience
* Chronic stroke phase: stroke duration ≥ 6 months
* Independent gait: Functional Ambulation Category (FAC) ≥ 3

Exclusion Criteria:

* Cognitive problem (MMSE \< 24)
* Visual or audio deficiency that might affect training
* Severe heart insufficiency or uncontrolled arterial hypertension
* Orthopedic disorders that affecting their gait
